bug.author: kinghuang
bug.summary: Unable to get --server.baseUrlPath option to work
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
Streamlit 0.49.0 introduces a --server.baseUrlPath option to modify Streamlit's URL. I can't seem to figure out how to get it to work. <denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
I'm running streamlit like so in a container: <denchmark-code>$ streamlit run --server.baseUrlPath /spendanalytics/data-pipelines/sa-text-cleanup sa/gui.py
You can now view your Streamlit app in your browser.
Network URL: http://XX.XX.XX.XX:8501/spendanalytics/data-pipelines/sa-text-cleanup External URL: http://XX.XX.XX.XX:8501/spendanalytics/data-pipelines/sa-text-cleanup </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
I should be able to access Streamlit at <denchmark-link:http://XX.XX.XX.XX:8501/spendanalytics/data-pipelines/sa-text-cleanup>http://XX.XX.XX.XX:8501/spendanalytics/data-pipelines/sa-text-cleanup</denchmark-link> . <denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
I'm just getting a 404: Not Found accessing the url. Here's an example with curl. <denchmark-code>curl http://XX.XX.XX.XX:8501/spendanalytics/data-pipelines/sa-text-cleanup <html><title>404: Not Found</title><body>404: Not Found</body></html> </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>Is this a regression?</denchmark-h>
no <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
Streamlit version: Streamlit, version 0.49.0 Python version: Python 3.8.0 Using Conda? PipEnv? PyEnv? Pex? Installed streamlit using pip OS version: Debian GNU/Linux 10 (buster) Browser version: Safari 13.0.2 and curl 7.64.0
<denchmark-h:h1>Additional information</denchmark-h>
If needed, add any other context about the problem here.

comments.comment: The URL that the console/terminal shows is incorrect. It needs to include a trailing forward slash. But I prefer that a trailing forward slash is not required. Someone else already created an issue for missing trailing forward slash. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues/525>#525</denchmark-link>
Yeah, I opened the other issue, too. I'll open a PR to fix that, soon.
